summary: Added worldsim/types.py defining core immutable data types (Position, Agent, WorldState, StepResult, TickMetrics, SimConfig) as typing.NamedTuple containers with specified fields and defaults.

writes.content:
from __future__ import annotations

from typing import NamedTuple, Tuple


class Position(NamedTuple):
    row: int
    col: int


class Agent(NamedTuple):
    energy: int
    age: int
    direction: int  # 0=North 1=East 2=South 3=West


class WorldState(NamedTuple):
    width: int
    height: int
    step_number: int
    seed: int
    agents: Tuple[Tuple[Position, Agent], ...]  # sorted by Position for determinism


class StepResult(NamedTuple):
    world: WorldState
    births: int
    deaths: int
    movements: int


class TickMetrics(NamedTuple):
    step_number: int
    population: int
    births: int
    deaths: int
    avg_energy: float
    density: float  # population / (width * height)


class SimConfig(NamedTuple):
    width: int
    height: int
    seed: int
    initial_density: float = 0.3
    max_steps: int = 100
    initial_energy: int = 10
    energy_gain: int = 2
    move_cost: int = 1
    reproduction_threshold: int = 15
    reproduction_cost: int = 8
    max_age: int = 50
